008 *******************************************************************************/
009package Ch07_MorphologicalFilters;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
013import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
014import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
015import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
016import imagingbook.common.ij.GuiTools;
017import imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils;
018import imagingbook.common.morphology.BinaryClosing;
019import imagingbook.common.morphology.BinaryDilation;
020import imagingbook.common.morphology.BinaryErosion;
021import imagingbook.common.morphology.BinaryMorphologyFilter;
022import imagingbook.common.morphology.BinaryOpening;
023import imagingbook.common.morphology.StructuringElements;
024
025/**
026 * <p>
027 * This plugin implements a binary morphology filter (dilation, erosion, 
028 * opening, or closing) using a disk-shaped
029 * structuring element whose radius can be specified.
030 * See Sec. 7.2 of [1] for additional details.
031 * This plugin works on 8-bit grayscale images only.
032 * Zero-value pixels are considered background, all other pixels
033 * are foreground. Different to ImageJ's built-in morphological
034 * operators, this implementation does not incorporate the current display 
035 * lookup-table (LUT).
036 * </p> 
037 * <p>
038 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic
039 * Approach</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
040 * </p>
041 * @author WB
042 * @version 2022/01/24
043 */
044public class Bin_Morphology_Disk implements PlugInFilter {
045        
046        public enum OpType {
047                Dilate, Erode, Open, Close;
048        }
049
050        /** Operation type (dilation, erosion, opening, closing). */
051        public static OpType Operation = OpType.Dilate;
052        /** Radius of the structuring element. */
053        public static double Radius = 1.0;
054        /** Display the structuring element as a binary image. */
055        public static boolean ShowStructuringElement = false;
056
057        @Override
058        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus imp) {
059                return DOES_8G;
060        }
061
062        @Override
063        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
064                if (!showDialog()) {
065                        return;
066                }
067                
068                ByteProcessor bp = (ByteProcessor) ip;
069                byte[][] H = StructuringElements.makeDiskKernel(Radius);
070                
071                BinaryMorphologyFilter filter = null;
072                switch(Operation) {
073                case Close:
074                        filter = new BinaryClosing(H); break;
075                case Dilate:
076                        filter = new BinaryDilation(H); break;
077                case Erode:
078                        filter = new BinaryErosion(H); break;
079                case Open:
080                        filter = new BinaryOpening(H); break;
081                }
082                
083                filter.applyTo(bp);
084                
085                if (ShowStructuringElement) {
086                        ByteProcessor pH = IjUtils.toByteProcessor(H);
087                        pH.invertLut();
088                        pH.setMinAndMax(0, 1);
089                        ImagePlus iH = new ImagePlus("H", pH);
090                        iH.show();
091                        GuiTools.zoomExact(iH, 10);
092                }
093        }
094
095        private boolean showDialog() {
096                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());
097                gd.addNumericField("Radius (filters only)", 1.0, 1, 5, "pixels");
098                gd.addEnumChoice("Operation", Operation);
099                gd.addCheckbox("Show structuring element", ShowStructuringElement);
100
101                gd.showDialog();
102                if (gd.wasCanceled())
103                        return false;
104                
105                Radius = gd.getNextNumber();
106                Operation = gd.getNextEnumChoice(OpType.class);
107                ShowStructuringElement = gd.getNextBoolean();
108                return true;
109        }
110        
111}
